tool.description: STAR analysis for groups of samples, PE reads

repeat.name: group1
repeat.title: FASTQ file for sample
repeat.help: You can add up to 20 samples

param.name: groups
param.label: You can assign sample into groups, e.g. group 1 as case and group 2 as control, we support up to 4 groups

param.name: group1_name
param.label: Please enter a unique sample ID

configfiles.configfile: Read PE Reference $ref_file.fields.path Samples #for $i, $s in enumerate( $group1) ${s.groups} ${s.group1_inputR1.file_name} ${s.group1_inputR2.file_name} ${s.group1_name} #end for

tool.help:
Summary: This workflow runs STAR workflow for up to 4 groups of samples. Each group can have multiple samples. The input must be paired ended (PE) fastq files for each sample.
For each sample, the workflow run the following process: 1. QC, the low quality reads will be removed and low quality bases will be trimmed 2. map the reads to reference genome (1st pass) 3. run 2nd pass mapping using the detected junctions from 1st pass pooled from all samples 4. run RSEM
For any pair of groups, the workflow run: 1. diff. analysis with EdgeR
Input: 1. select the reference genome 2. PE fastq files (2 files) for each sample click "add new FASTQ file for sample" to add a new sample select a group for the sample and give a unique sample name
Output: 1. report, reads count etc 2. coordinator-sorted bam file for alignments to reference genome 3. bam file for alignments to reference transcriptome 4. bedgraph file for alignmentss to reference genome 5. RSEM gene results and isoform results 6. difference results
